settings.heading: L-MENTHOL
settings.subheading: L-menthol is a natural substance that is derived from mint plants. It has a cooling and refreshing effect, which can help to relieve the itching and burning associated with eczema.

settings.heading: Pseudolarix amabilis Rehd
settings.subheading: Pseudolarix amabilis Rehd, the Golden Larch, contains pseudolaric acid A with anti-inflammatory and anti-allergic properties. This makes it a potential natural treatment for eczema, a chronic itchy and inflamed skin condition.

settings.heading: Latin Tite
settings.subheading: Latin Tite leaves contain corosolic acid, with anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties. The plant is thought to soothe and strengthen the skin's barrier, possibly reducing eczema symptoms.

settings.heading: Sophora flavescens
settings.subheading: Sophoricoside, an anti-inflammatory and anti-allergic compound found in Sophora flavescens roots, shows potential as an eczema treatment due to eczema's inflammatory and itchy nature.

settings.heading: Rhizoma Smilacis Glabrae
settings.subheading: One of the main active compounds in Rhizoma Smilacis Glabrae is sarsaparillin, which has been shown to have anti-inflammatory effects. It can help to reduce the redness, swelling, and itching associated with eczema.
